Killing Floor is basically a Co-Op (Or singleplayer) Zombie killing arena. There are various types of enemies, each with its own strengths and weaknesses. Some might be harmful to you as a certain class, but as another class they would be virtually helpless against you. There are several perks (I call them classes as well) that you can choose depending on the situation or your taste.

Killing Floor doesn't really have much of a story (nor a campaign I'm afraid, but that would be AWESOME.) But it's a pretty good game if you're into that sort of thing.

Overall I give the game a 8 out of 10, fun game you can play with your friends, I recommend buying it when it's on sale.
RECOMMENDED !!!

A great co-op horror game. I've been stuck playin' this game forever. It was the first game I got when I joined Steam. It runs smooth, steady and the game's fairly easy to get a hold on. Nothin' beats a slow-mo'd gush of brain splatter. 'course every now and again you'll run into a bad pinch of som'thin' but, hey nothin's perfect. I recommend this game as a Zombie Genocide enthusiast. 9.5/10

One of the best games out there, just for the sheer fun of it. Unlike Left4Dead, this game not only pits you against all sorts of creatures (not just a handful of special zombies) and isn't reliant on teambased objectives. Rather, the only point of the game is to survive, and that alone makes it fun. Map Modders create impressive maps and the perks, skins, and weapons make it a game worth trying.

Absolutely fun!  Bascially a 6 player co-op survival horror last man standing gameplay type game.  Updated very regularly and updates include seasonal updates with reskins of the ZEDs (monsters) for the season we're on (IE: Christmas).

There are 6 perks (classes) to choose from and you can level them up the more you use them to level 6.  You can choose from medic, support (shotguns & weild doors), sharpshooter (sniper), commando (assualt rifles & see enemies health), berzerker (melee), firebug (uses fire weapons) and the demolition (explosives expert).  All need to work together to bring down the ZEDs.  

There are 10 different ZEDs to fight all ranging from regular ZEDs to minibosses to a final boss.  There are a lot of maps to choose from with a lively community and a workshop!

If you've played the Left 4 Dead series this is kinda like it so you can better understand what it's like.  Goes on sale ALL the time.  You'll be able to grab the full game and all the DLC for under $13. gogogog!!!
Would have to say one of the best games on steam...great survival-horror.

I will remember my first playing Killing Floor for the rest of my life.
I was too young to have a credit card and buy stuff online but i really wanted to try this game, so i downloaded a pirate version of it. I just knew that it was a horde mutant shooter but never saw it in action.
I can see myself spawning for the first time, the map was KF-Bedlam and the first thing i did was shooting the wall with the 9mm, and it was like "WOW". The gunshot was feeling so good and powerful, that's the first thing that hooked me in this game. I played on this pirated version for countless hours. I was unable to level up on this version so all my perks was level 0, but i didn't care, the game was too good. I purchased it when i've been able to, and kept playing this awesome game. The game was often updated and i thanks Tripwire for these gifts from the gods.

Today, Killing Floor 2 is making a lot of thing better. I will not return to Killing Floor except for some nostalgia sessions, but Killing Floor had something than Killing Floor 2 doesn't have. This game has an atmosphere, a feeling. Something creepy, like a dream or a nightmare. It's really hard to describe, but for this reason it can still makes sense to play KF1 over KF2. KF1 is also a lot slower than KF2, it's not better or worse, but different.

If you never played this game, i can only recommend it, it's awesome ! But i have a little warning : the game has some element that are not very intuitive for new players and some movement and controls are pretty dated. You may have an hard time as a new player if you're not used to older games, but once you tamed it, it's only good fun :D

KF1 & KF2 are probably my favorite games with Doom & Doom 2.

After 8 years this is still a very fun and satisfying fps experience. The community is small and a lot of servers have disappeared since Killing Floor 2s release but this game is still worth every cent. Get some friends together and save London!
